intro: Hieracium exsurgens, commonly known as the upstanding hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Hieracium exsurgens is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
